chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jim Legault was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Jim Legault was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jim Legault is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Jim Legault was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Jim Legault was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Amended to include restitution.
Mr Legault has requested that the November 23rd hearing be removed from the calendar.  He will not be retaining counsel to contest the restitution.

10/24/2016 Hearing
Exhibits located in Exhibit room FC 1-3
Restitution hearing on November 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jim  Legault in court.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State advises court as to the status of proceedings.  Defendant makes statements.  Court will hear testimony regarding restitution today, but will withhold judgment and schedule a follow-up restitution hearing to allow the defendant to retain counsel and contest restitution amounts if the defendant so desires.  Lieutenant Wucherer sworn and testifies.  Court will withhold judgment for a period of two weeks.  If the defendant wishes to retain counsel and contest restitution, the Defendant is to notify the court by Monday, November 7th, 2016.  State makes arguments.  Defendant makes arguments.  State makes rebuttal.  Court withholds judgment and advises Defendant.  Restitution hearing scheduled for November 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Motion and Proposed Order to Withdraw as Defendant's Counsel. Forwarded to Branch 2 clerk.
Restitution hearing on October 24, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jim  Legault in court with attorney Brian C. Hough.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommend as to sentencing.  Attorney Hough makes recommendation as to sentencing.  Attorney Hough opposes restitution, and requests that if restitution is ordered that a restitution hearing be scheduled.  Court will schedule a restitution hearing.  Court renders judgment.  Restitution hearing scheduled for October 24, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on September 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jim  Legault in court with attorney Brian C. Hough.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendation as to sentencing.  Counsel advises court of facts of case.  State is not prepared to argue facts of case and proceed with sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

7/12/2016 Trial   Exhibit 3 located in CD/DVD Exhibit binder
Exhibits located in Exhibit room FC 1-3
Court voir dire questions w/preliminary instructions

Atty. Adam Gerol appears for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appears in person and by Atty. Brian Hough and Atty. Eric Hunt. Atty. Hough requests sequestration of witnesses. Court so orders. 
 9:03 am     Jurors reported and given oath. 
 9:05  am    Voir dire by Court.
 9:22  am    Voir dire by Atty. Gerol.
 9:32  am    Voir dire by Atty. Hough.
 9:40  am    Counsel striking of jury.
 9:50  am    12 jurors called to hear case.  All other jurors thanked and excused. 
 9:51  am    Jury given oath. 
 9:52  am    Court preliminary instructions to jury.
10:00 am    Jury excused. Court and counsel statements.
10:02 am    Court/counsel recess. 
10:20 am    Court returns from recess.  Jury recalled to the court room.
10:21 am    Atty. Gerol opening statements.
10:30 am    Atty. Hough opening statements.
10:41 am    State witness, D.G. sworn and testifies.
11:01 am    State witness, Chief Nicholson sworn and testifies.
12:15 pm    Jury excused for lunch.
12:17 pm    Court breaks for lunch.
01:39 pm    Court returns from break.
01:40 pm    Court reviews rights not to testify with defendant outside the presence of the Jury.
01:43 pm    Jury recalled to the court room.
01:44 pm    State witness, Lieutenant Wucherer sworn and testifies.
02:50 pm    State rests.
02:51 pm    Jury excused for break.
02:51 pm    Counsel moves to dismiss charges against the Defendant.  State opposes motion.  Court denies motion.
02:54 pm    Court reviews submitted Exhibits.  Parties distinguish portions of Exhibit 3 used thus far.
02:56 pm    Court/Counsel recess.
03:13 pm    Court, Counsel, and Jurors return from recess.
03:14 pm    Defense witness, Jim Legault sworn and testifies.
04:05 pm    Defense witness, C.G. sworn and testifies.
04:59 pm    Defense has no further witnesses.
05:00 pm    Jury excused for break.
05:01 pm    Court goes off the record to discuss continuation of case and Jury Instructions.
05:27 pm    Court goes back on the record to discuss Jury Instructions outside the presence of the Jury.
05:37 pm    Jurors recalled to the court room.
05:38 pm    Court delivers Jury Instructions to the Jurors.
05:57 pm    Closing statements by Atty Gerol.
06:13 pm    Closing statements by Atty Hough.
06:30 pm    Rebuttal statements by Atty Gerol.
06:37 pm    Court further instructs the Jury.
06:42 pm    Bailiff sworn.
06:43 pm    Jury leaves for deliberation.
06:45 pm    Court hears argument in regards to "missing witness" argument made by Defense Counsel during closing statements.
07:45 pm    Court is informed that the Jury has reached a verdict.
07:59 pm    Court, Counsel and Jury present in court.
08:00 pm    Verdict read:  Count 1 Not Guilty;  Count 2 Not Guilty;  Count 3 Guilty;  Count 4 Guilty
08:02 pm    Counsel requests court poll the jury.
08:04 pm    Jury polled, all Jurors respond affirmatively.  Jurors thanked and excused.
08:05 pm    Parties jointly request judgments on verdict as to all four counts.
08:06 pm    Court adjourns sentencing.  Scheduling held off the record.  Sentencing Hearing scheduled Monday, August 8th, 2016 at 09:30 am
